thread.title: Former Newcastle United winger Gabriel Obertan has joined Championship side Wigan Athletic on a free transfer until the end of the season
thread.title_full: Former Newcastle United winger Gabriel Obertan has joined Championship side Wigan Athletic on a free transfer until the end of the season

author: sunsportonline
title: Former Newcastle United winger Gabriel Obertan has joined Championship side Wigan Athletic on a free transfer until the end of the season
text:
EFL Gab's the man Former Newcastle United winger Gabriel Obertan has joined Championship side Wigan Athletic on a free transfer until the end of the season 
The 27-year-old returns to England after being released from Russian club Anzhi Makhachkala by jake lambourne Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GABRIEL OBERTAN has returned to England after signing a deal with Wigan Athletic until the end of the season. 
The 27-year-old winger has signed on a free transfer, after he was released by Russian club Anzhi Makhachkala despite joining them in the summer. Gabriel Obertan has joined the Latics on a deal until the end of the season Getty Images 4 The winger was released by Newcastle United at the end of the last campaign 
The deal is subject to international clearance, but Latics boss Warren Joyce believes the Frenchman can be a real asset to squad. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip in the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog 
Joyce knows the player well having previously been the Manchester United reserves team boss, a side that Obertan spent two years at. 
He said: “He adds great experience to the squad and offers us another option in the wide areas. He’s a top professional with great quality.” 
Obertan said of the deal: “It’s great to be here. Warren Joyce called me and was a big part of my decision to join the club. I’m glad to be here and can’t wait to get started. PA:Press Association The winger only managed to score three goals in five years at Newcastle United Related stories VILLA LAND HOGAN Scott Hogan completes £14m move to Aston Villa after West Ham pull out of race for Brentford striker Bielik is a blue Arsenal youngster Krystian Bielik joins Birmingham on loan until the end of the season He's B-ake for good Chelsea reject £18million Bournemouth bid for Nathan Ake, reveals Eddie Howe Veen-dish move Scunthorpe reject sensational £4m Chinese Super League offer for striker Kevin van Veen Seize the Diay Hull bolster their ranks with signing of Villarreal midfielder Alfred N'Diaye on season-long loan TO BE RAVEL-ED... Former Manchester United wonderkid Ravel Morrison returns to QPR from Lazio on loan ALL SYSTEMS GUE Watford's Adlene Guedioura opts for Middlesbrough over Hull City after both clubs offer £3.5million in the sak Liverpool outcast Mamadou Sakho joins Crystal Palace on loan until the end of the season LUK WHO'S SIGNED Crystal Palace confirm signing Luka Milivojevic for a fee believed to be 'around £12m' One in, One out Swansea complete signing of Jordan Ayew from Aston Villa with Neil Taylor moving the other way gift of the gab Southampton sign Napoli striker and Italian international Manolo Gabbiadini BEG-GER OFF Chelsea reject Watford's £10million PLUS Heurelho Gomes bid for Asmir Begovic Reuters 4 The Frenchman only mustered a solitary goal for Manchester United – a strike that came in the Champions League 
“I worked with Warren when we were together at Manchester United and he’s a coach who has always pushed me. I respect him a lot and hopefully I’ll repay him with my performances this season. 
“Warren didn’t lie to me and he told me the situation the club were in. I’m up for it and hopefully we’ll move away from the bottom of the table. 
“I wanted to come back to England to show my true potential. All the ingredients for that to happen are here with the right coach and a young team.” 
Wigan are in danger of being relegated to the EFL League One as they sit in 22nd place, winning just six out of 27 league games. Sky Sports News presenter is hit with a dildo on transfer deadline day in 2014 
They are the division's lowest goalscorers having found the back of the net just 24 times, and hope Obertan can provide some Premier League quality in the final third. 
However they can't expect a natural born finisher, in eight games at Anzhi he only found the back of the net once. 
In 76 games for Newcastle spanning five years he only scored three times, and netted just once in 28 appearances for the Red Devils.
